Curator's comments: A tube projects downwards from the central hole into the interior; this was probably for dipping the pen. The other hole, at the side, may have been used for filling and cleaning out the container and would have been kept plugged when the inkwell was in use. (Coutts 1988, 93) Published: H. Coutts, 1998. Gold of the Pharaohs, pp. 92-93 [68/C]. F. Petrie, Tanis I, p.45 C. Favard-Meeks.1998. 'Mise à jour des ouvrages de Flinders Petrie sur les fouilles de Tanis' in Brissaud, Philippe and Christiane Zivie-Coche (eds), Tanis: travaux récents sur le Tell Sân el-Hagar [1], p.130. I. Regulski (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, pp. 225-6
Bibliographic references: Pattie & Turner 1974 / The Written Word on Papyrus: An Exhibition Held in the British Museum 30 July - 27 October 1974 (no.17)
Exhibition history: 2015, 19th June - 5th Sept. Wrexham County Borough Museum.
